importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the incident and public response occurred.
The date of Doug Martin's NFL draft selection (31st overall in the first round), marking the beginning of his professional football career.
The year Martin achieved another Pro Bowl selection and first-team All-Pro honors, highlighting a peak in his performance.
The date of Martin's arrest and death, when he became unresponsive during a police detention following a break-in investigation.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin played for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including his draft year and peak performance years, illustrating the timeline of his professional football career.
The period from 2015 to 2025, covering his final seasons and the aftermath of his death in 2025, showing the timeline from peak career to public tragedy.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back and All-Pro, died after a brief struggle with police during a custody operation related to a break-in in Oakland.
Martin was a standout player for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, with a career spanning from 2012 to 2017, and was recognized as one of the franchise’s top 50 players.
The incident highlights ongoing concerns about police interactions with individuals, especially in communities with high rates of crime or social tension.
The death of a public figure like Martin has prompted public mourning and a broader discussion about police conduct and accountability.
Martin’s family requested privacy, and officials from Oakland police and the city’s mayor extended condolences, showing community-level recognition of his impact.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The central figure in the article; he died during a police interaction, making him the focal point of the event and public response.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back and standout player with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police while being detained in connection with a break-in at a home in Oakland. He was 36 and had a decorated career, including being selected first-team All-Pro twice and recognized as one of the franchise’s top 50 players. The incident has sparked public mourning, with officials from the Oakland Police Department, Mayor Barbara Lee, and the Buccaneers expressing condolences. A cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is scheduled. This event underscores ongoing concerns about police interactions with individuals and the impact of such tragedies on both personal and public spheres.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention During Break-In Investigation
